resources.string: It\'s time for a momentary evaluation!
Are you ready to start the assessment?
What time do you usually wake up in the morning?
What time do you usually go to sleep daily?
Do you choose to be a part of\n reserach study?
Note: \nIf you choose to be part of research study, only then you will be receiving notifications for Daily Assessments.
What time do you want to meditate daily?
What time on that day would you like to receive the lesson?
What day would you like to receive your weekly lesson?

This program is grounded in the latest research on mental and physical health. The goal is to teach you skills that help
First, do this little exercise: take two pencils, one in each hand, and place two pieces of paper in front of you. Close
your eyes and try not to think of anything. If a thought comes up, mark a tally on a paper near your right hand every
time it is about the future. Place a tally mark on the paper near your left hand if it is about the past. Do the exercise
for 1 minute, then open your eyes and count the marks.\r\n\r\n
Likely, your mind has jumped to the past or the future several times during the exercise. There is no inherent
problem with that. This program is not about changing your thoughts or emptying your mind. Instead, it is about
relating to your mind in a different way, understanding the nature of the mind-body connection and integrating your
experience into your daily life. You will do daily exercises that build awareness of your thoughts, feelings, and
physical sensations. These processes influence your day-to-day functioning and influence your life quality and
relationships with yourself, others and life in general.\r\n\r\n
Think of this example: you are at work and have mild symptoms of a headache. If these symptoms go unnoticed, it
can become a full-blown migraine, with irritation and discomfort. Another example: you are at home after work,
tired and a bit lonely. Without noticing, your turn on a TV and grab some food or a drink. After an hour or two you
This program won’t teach you how to change your lifestyle. In fact, it is not even designed to improve you in any way.
Instead, it will teach you three important tools: AWARENESS, NON-RESISTANCE and UNCONDITIONAL LOVE. Then,
you will be equipped to use these skills to live an authentic and harmonious life.\r\n\r\n
AWARENESS is objective information, unclouded by judgment. Imagine sitting with a friend and pouring your heart
out. Your friend listens with the utmost interest. She is eager to hear your voice and know everything about you but
won’t do anything with the information you share. She has NO RESISTANCE to anything you say and only listens and
accepts. When you pour your heart out, she knows your deepest worries, fears and desires and, with all that
knowledge, LOVES YOU UNCONDITIONALLY. She doesn’t care about changing or improving you in any way. She sees
Wouldn’t it be wonderful to have a friend like that? The good news is that YOU will become that friend to yourself.
With awareness, you will be able to see yourself, situations, and people around objectively. Without judgment and
with unconditional self-love, you won’t be motivated to make choices based on your external images or fears. With
love, you will be free to choose what the best option is for you and those around you. Without resistance, you will
build resilience to handle emotions, thoughts, and events coming your way.\r\n\r\n
This program is not a miracle, but it will equip you with important tools that can be applied daily. No intellectual
understanding can substitute your own experience and practice. If you don’t understand something or have
questions, that is normal; however, you need to bite an apple to know how it tastes and learn from your own
The program has eight modules that build on each other. Be patient as you practice the skills. Importantly, don’t get
disappointed if things go at a different pace than you expect – you will see, with practice, that the pace doesn’t make
a difference, the only metric of progress is your daily practice, no matter of its outcome. The program has two
components: guided meditations and daily applications to your life. Guided meditation is dedicated time to develop
new skills, and daily applications are opportunities to apply the skills to your life.\r\n\r\n\r\n
Enjoy your “JustBe” journey!\r\n\r\n
Communicate your feedback and questions to justbe@gmail.com\r\n\r\n

Yesterday, I was satisfied with my life.
Yesterday, I spent ___ hours on my leisure activities.
Today, after my sleep, I feel ___.
Last night, my dreams were bad.
Yesterday, I used TV/Computer/Videogame for ____ minutes.
Yesterday, I spent ___ hours with my friends or family.
During my social interactions yesterday, I was able to relate to the person/s around me.
During my social interactions yesterday, I felt isolated from others.
Yesterday, I used this techniques to deal with my stress:

string-array.name: stressManagementChoices
string-array.item: Took a moment to slow down
Paid deliberate attention to my actions
Distracted myself with TV, computer, or social media
Procrastinated or denied dealing with things
Used drugs or alcohol to deal with stress
Used food to improve my mood
Talked to people I trust to feel better

resources.string: It is hard for me to switch off my negative thoughts.
It is hard for you to focus on anything but my negative thoughts
I am dwelling on upsetting past events.
I am doing things and noticing my body sensations at the same time.
I am trying to control the type of sensations I feel in my body.
I am trying to interpret every sensation I feel in my body.
It’s impossible for me to pay attention to physical sensations I don’t like.
I am getting lost in my thoughts.
I am trying to control my thoughts.
I am curious and accepting towards my thoughts.
My thoughts are very important to me.
I get very affected by my thoughts.
I am trying to avoid certain types of thoughts.
I feel overwhelmed by my emotions.
I am trying to control my emotions.
I am curious and accepting towards my emotions.
My emotions are very important to me.
I get very affected by my emotions.
I am trying to avoid certain types of emotions.
